Class Ellipse

  • java.lang.Object

      • Shapes.Ellipse

extends Shapes
    Class for Ellipse object. Inherits from class Shapes.

      Ellipse​(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, java.awt.Color penColor, boolean fill, java.awt.Color fillColor)
      Creates an Ellipse that fits within the square created of (x1, y1) and (x2,y2).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ellipse

        public Ellipse​(double x1,
               double y1,
               double x2,
               double y2,
               java.awt.Color penColor,
               boolean fill,
               java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Creates an Ellipse that fits within the square created of (x1, y1) and (x2,y2). The points are in vec format (between 0 and 1).
        Parameters:
        x1 - Upper left corner of rectangle
        y1 - Upper left corner of rectangle
        x2 - Lower right corner of rectangle
        y2 - Lower right corner of rectangle
        penColor - Color of the boarder
        fill - Boolean value for fill
        fillColor - Fill color if fill=true

      • resize

        public void resize​(double x2,
                   double y2)
        Resizes the rectangle that describes the ellipse.
        Specified by:
        resize in class Shapes
        Parameters:
        x2 - New point
        y2 - New point

      • toVecFormat

        public java.lang.String toVecFormat()
        Creates a string command to create a Ellipse in vec format. The syntax for ellipse is "ELLIPSE [x1] [y1] [x2] [y2]"
        Specified by:
        toVecFormat in class Shapes
        Returns:
        the string command

      • draw

        public void draw​(java.awt.Graphics graphics,
                 int imageSize)
        Draws the ellipse on the graphicObject. Uses the image size to calculate the correct coordinates.
        Specified by:
        draw in class Shapes
        Parameters:
        graphics - Graphic object for drawing
        imageSize - The size of the image to be drawn at.
